tool_description: Build your own sensor application.  Ubidots simplifies the making of Internet of Things applications for data capturing, real-time remote monitoring and getting insights from sensor data.
name: Ubidots
title: Ubidots

api_list.name: GET /datasources/{datasource_id}/variables
api_list.description: This resource list the variables of a specified data source, showing all the fields of the variables.

utterances.utterance: Can you list all the variables for the data source with ID 'sensor123'?
Show me the variables associated with the data source ID 'weatherStation01'.
What are the variables for the data source identified by 'device456'?
Retrieve the list of variables for the data source with ID 'envMonitor789'.
I need to see all variables for the data source 'agriSensor001'.
Please provide the variables for the data source with ID 'homeAutomation02'.
List the variables for the data source 'industrialSensor03'.
What variables are available for the data source 'smartCitySensor04'?
Get the variables for the data source with ID 'healthMonitor05'.
Could you show me the variables for the data source 'energyMeter06'?

api_list.name: GET /variables/{variable_id}
api_list.description: This resource returns a variable and its details. It shows additional fields than the ones required during the creation of the variable:  last_value: Shows the last value written to the variable.

utterances.utterance: What is the latest reading for the temperature sensor with ID temp123?
Can you provide the last recorded value for the humidity sensor with ID hum456?
Fetch the most recent data for the pressure sensor identified by ID pres789.
I need the last value for the light sensor with the ID light101.
Retrieve the latest measurement for the motion sensor with ID motion202.
What was the last value recorded by the CO2 sensor with ID co2303?
Get the most recent reading for the sound sensor with ID sound404.
Please provide the last recorded data for the water level sensor with ID water505.
What is the latest value for the gas sensor with ID gas606?
Can you show me the last value for the vibration sensor with ID vib707?

api_list.name: GET /variables
api_list.description: Retrieves the list of all the variables owned by a user. The header X-Auth-Token is needed to have the permissions for this endpoint.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://community-ubidots.p.rapidapi.com/variables"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "community-ubidots.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

url = "https://community-ubidots.p.rapidapi.com/variables"

            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",

api_list.name: GET /datasources
api_list.description: This resource lists all the existing data sources of a user.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://community-ubidots.p.rapidapi.com/datasources"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "community-ubidots.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: GET /datasources/{datasource_id}
api_list.description: This resource obtains an existing data source and its details. Also, it returns additional fields besides the ones required during the creation of the data source:  number_of_variables: Shows the number of variables contained by the data source. last_activity: Returns the date of the last activity

utterances.utterance: Can you provide details for the data source with ID 'sensor123'?

api_list.name: GET /variables/{variable_id}/values
api_list.description: This resource returns the values of the specified variable.  Every value will have a timestamp which is a value in milliseconds according to the POSIX standard.

utterances.utterance: What are the latest readings for the temperature sensor with ID temp123?
Can you provide the data values for the humidity sensor identified by hum456?
Fetch the recorded values for the pressure sensor with the ID pres789.
I need the historical data for the light sensor with ID light101.
Retrieve the value logs for the motion detector identified by motion202.
Get the data points for the CO2 sensor with the ID co2303.
Show me the value history for the water level sensor with ID water404.
Access the recorded values for the wind speed sensor identified by wind505.
What are the recent data entries for the noise sensor with ID noise606?
Please provide the value records for the air quality sensor with ID air707.

api_list.name: POST /variables/{variable_id}/values
api_list.description: This resource creates a new value within the specified variable. Every value has a timestamp that can be either specified manually by the device, or automatically by the server.

utterances.utterance: Add a new temperature reading to the variable with ID temp123.
Log the latest humidity data to the variable identified by hum456.
Record a new pressure value in the variable with ID pres789.
Update the variable with ID light101 with the latest light intensity measurement.
Send a new CO2 level reading to the variable with ID co2202.
Insert a new wind speed value into the variable identified by wind303.
Add the latest rainfall measurement to the variable with ID rain404.
Log a new soil moisture reading to the variable with ID soil505.
Record the latest UV index in the variable identified by uv606.
Update the variable with ID noise707 with the latest noise level data.

api_list.name: POST /datasources
api_list.description: This resource creates a new data source. Every data source owns a number of variables, and has a context with different attributes. For example, a data source called “Delivery Truck” can have a attributes like {“City”: “Boston”} or {“Type”: “Truck”}.  Attributes are not meant to change dynamically over time, but to add a “relational” layer to your data sources.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://community-ubidots.p.rapidapi.com/datasources"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "community-ubidots.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: POST /datasources/{datasource_id}/variables
api_list.description: This resource creates a new variable within the specified data source. You can assign tags to variables (i.e. “room”, “yard”), and also properties with atributes, for example: {“Color”: “Blue”} or {“Status”: “OFF”}

utterances.utterance: Create a new temperature variable in the greenhouse data source.
Add a humidity sensor variable to the weather_station data source.
Set up a new light intensity variable in the smart_home data source.
Create a pressure variable for the industrial_plant data source.
Add a wind speed variable to the coastal_monitoring data source.
Introduce a new soil moisture variable in the farm_data data source.
Create a CO2 level variable for the urban_air_quality data source.
Add a water level variable to the reservoir_monitoring data source.
Set up a new energy consumption variable in the building_management data source.
Create a noise level variable for the city_environment data source.

api_list.name: POST /collections/values
api_list.description: This resource allow the create a value for multiple variables. Every value has a timestamp that can be either specified manually by the device, or automatically by the server.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://community-ubidots.p.rapidapi.com/collections/values"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "community-ubidots.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
